column2: (on TV) Well, if we learned one thing today C.H.E.E.S.E. is that\ncheerleaders and high explosives don\xc2\x92t mix. (Cut to Joey laughing while Rachel,\nChandler, and Monica aren\xc2\x92t amused.)'
You can say that again Mac.'
Well, I couldn\xc2\x92t have done it without you buddy. You\xc2\x92re a genius.'
Oh yeah? Well then how come I can\xc2\x92t get my VCR to stop\nblinking 12
(laughing and turning off the TV) So, what did you guys think?'
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Hold on please. Joey, it\xc2\x92s your mom.\n(Hands him the phone.)'
It\xc2\x92s your mommy. It\xc2\x92s your mommy.'
Ohhhh\xc2\x85'
That\xc2\x92s nice.'
(on phone) Mom, so what did you think? (He walks away allowing the gang a\nchance to figure out what they\xc2\x92re gonna say.)'
Well that was umm\xc2\x85Okay.'
It wasn\xc2\x92t the best.'
That was one of the worse things ever. And not just on TV.'
Wh-what are we gonna tell him?'
Well, the lighting was okay.'
Ohh no you don\xc2\x92t! You got lighting last time, lighting is mine!'
And I have costumes.'
Oh great! That means I\xc2\x92m stuck with, "So, we were watching you\nin there (Points to the TV) and you were sittin\xc2\x92 right here! Whoa!"'
What are you gonna do Pheebs?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. I don\xc2\x92t know. I can\xc2\x92t lie to him again. Oh\nno I\xc2\x97no! I\xc2\x92m just gonna press my breasts up against him.'
And say nothing?'
Uh-huh, yeah that\xc2\x92s right.'
(hangs up the phone) Wow! Well, my folks really liked it! So what-what did\nyou guys think? (Phoebe smiles, walks up to him, and presses her breasts against him.) It\nwasn\xc2\x92t that good.'
Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?'
What? You mean behind my back?'
(entering, excitedly) Oh! Hi you guys, oh my God! You\xc2\x92ll never\ngonna believe happened to me today! I am sitting in my office and\xc2\x85'
(entering from bathrooms excitedly) You guys! You guys! You\xc2\x92re not\ngonna believe what my agent just told me!'
Joey! Kinda in the middle of a story here!'
Ooh, sorry. Sorry. You finish, go.'
Okay, so anyway I\xc2\x92m sittin\xc2\x92 in my office and guess who walks\nin.'
I\xc2\x92m gonna be on two TV shows!'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s great!!'
Joey!'
Oh, you weren\xc2\x92t finished?'
Yeah! Guess who walks into my office is the end of my story. (To Monica\nand Phoebe) It was Ralph Lauren! (Monica and Phoebe gasp) Ralph Lauren walked into my\noffice!'
Uh Rach, if you\xc2\x92re gonna start another story, at least let me finish\nmine.'
It\xc2\x92s the same story.'
(groans in disgust) Wow, it\xc2\x92s really long.'
(ignoring him) Anyway, Ralph just came in to tell me that he\xc2\x92s so\nhappy with my work that he wants me to be the new merchandising manager for polo retail.'
Still get a discount on wedding dresses?'
Yeah!'
I\xc2\x92m so happy for you!'
Well, these really are the days of our lives.'
What?!'
Well, since you ask. They want me back on Days of Our Lives!'
(gasps) Oh God!'
I got\xc2\x97I get a big pay raise!'
Oh hey!'
I\xc2\x92ll be playing Drake Remoray\xc2\x92s twin brother, Stryker!'
Oooh!'
I get to hire my own assistant!'
Ahhh!!'
(jumps up) Well\xc2\x97I got a head rush from standing up to fast right\nthere.'
(reading the resume) And you were at this job for four years?'
That\xc2\x92s right.'
Okay, well this is all very impressive Hilda, um I just have one last\nquestion for you. Uh, how did I do? Was this okay?'
What?'
I\xc2\x92ve never interviewed anyone before. I\xc2\x92ve actually never had\nanyone work for me before. Although when I was a kid, we did have a maid, but this\nis-this isn\xc2\x92t the same thing. '
No dear. It\xc2\x92s not.'
No. Yeah, and I know that. All right, well thank you so much for coming\nin it was nice to meet you.'
Thank you! Good meeting you.'
All right. (Hilda exits) I\xc2\x92m a total pro!'
Hello?'
(seeing him) Wow! H-umm! Hi! Yes, uh I\xc2\x92m sorry the models are\nactually down the hall.'
Actually, I\xc2\x92m here about the assistant job.'
Really?! (Taking his resume) Okay well then, all right, well just have a\nseat there. Umm, so what\xc2\x92s\xc2\x97what is\xc2\x97what\xc2\x92s your name?'
Tag Jones.'
Uh-huh, go on.'
That\xc2\x92s it. That\xc2\x92s my whole name.'
That\xc2\x92s your whole name, okay of course it is! Okay, well\nlet\xc2\x92s-let\xc2\x92s just have a look-see here. (Looking at his resume)'
I know I haven\xc2\x92t worked in an office before, and I really don\xc2\x92t\nhave a lot of experience, but uh\xc2\x85'
Oh come on, what are you talking about? You\xc2\x92ve got three years\npainting houses. Two whole summers at T.G.I. Friday\xc2\x92s, come on!'
It\xc2\x92s lame, I know. But I\xc2\x92m a goal-oriented person, very eager to\nlearn\xc2\x85'
Okay, hold on just a second. (She grabs a camera out of the desk and\ntakes his picture.) I\xc2\x92m sorry, it\xc2\x92s for human resources, everybody has to do it.\nCould you just stand up please?'
No-no-no-no. (Waves him away as Monica and Phoebe enter whispering to\neach other.) Hey! (Monica shushes him.)'
(To Monica) Anyway, I should go. Okay, bye.'
(To Chandler) Hey sweetie.'
Hi sweetie. So, what was with all the whispering?'
I can\xc2\x92t tell you. It\xc2\x92s a secret.'
Secret? Married people aren\xc2\x92t supposed to have secrets between\none another. We have too much love and respect for one another.'
Awww. (Kisses him.) But still no.'
No I\xc2\x92m serious, we should tell each other everything. I do\nnot have any secrets from you.'
Really? Okay, so why don\xc2\x92t you tell me what happened to Ross Junior\nyear at Disneyland?'
Oh no-no, I can\xc2\x92t do that.'
If you tell me, I\xc2\x92ll tell you what Phoebe said.'
Okay.'
Okay.'

So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this
restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of
his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, we\xc2\x92re on Space Mountain and
Ross starts to feel a little iffy.'
Oh my God. He threw up?'
No, he visited a little town south of throw up. (Monica laughs\nhysterically.) So what was Phoebe\xc2\x92s secret?'
Oh, Nancy Thompson from Phoebe\xc2\x92s old massage place is getting\nfired.'
That\xc2\x92s it?! I gave up my Disneyland story for that?'
That\xc2\x92s right! You lose sucker!! (Pause) Please still marry me.'
Chandler, you have an assistant right?'
(angrily) Did she call? You-you told her I was sick right? Always tell\nher I am sick!'

No, I-I just don\xc2\x92t know how you decide who to hire. I mean\nI\xc2\x92ve got it narrowed down to two people. One of them has great references and a lot\nof experience and then there\xc2\x92s this guy\xc2\x85'
What about him?'
I love him. He\xc2\x92s so pretty I wanna cry! I don\xc2\x92t know what to\ndo. Tell me what to do.'
Come on you know what to do! You hire the first one! You don\xc2\x92t hire\nan assistant because they\xc2\x92re cute, you hire them because they\xc2\x92re qualified.'
Uh-huh. No, I hear what you\xc2\x92re saying and-and-and that makes a lot\nof sense but can I just say one more thing? (Takes out his picture.) Look how pretty!'

Let\xc2\x92s see. (Looking at the picture) Oh my God! Oh\xc2\x85 But no! No!\nYou can\xc2\x92t-you can\xc2\x92t hire him, because that\xc2\x97it\xc2\x92s not professional. Umm,\nthis is for me (The picture) yes? Thanks. (Puts it in her pocket.)'
Okay you\xc2\x92re right. I\xc2\x92ll hire Hilda tomorrow. Dumb old perfect\nfor the job Hilda!'
Let me see this guy. (Phoebe hands him the picture.) W-H-Wow!\nDon\xc2\x92t show this to Monica! And don\xc2\x92t tell her about the W-H-Wow!'
Hey-hey-hey Joey!'
Hey Terry!'
Good to see you again!'
It\xc2\x92s been a while, huh? Wow, it\xc2\x92s funny these halls look smaller\nthen they used to.'
It\xc2\x92s a different building.'
So! Stryker Remoray huh? When do you want me to start?'
Why don\xc2\x92t we start right now!'
Okay.'
Here are the audition scenes. (Holds out the script.)'
(looking between the pages and him) Audition? I thought you were gonna\noffer me the part.'
Why would you think that?'
Well, I was Dr. Drake Remoray, Stryker\xc2\x92s twin brother. I mean, who\nlooks more me than me right?'
Everybody has to audition.'
Y\xc2\x92know Terry, I-I don\xc2\x92t really need to do this. I got my\nown cable TV series, (Pause) with a robot.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry Joey that\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85that\xc2\x92s the way it is.'

Well. I guess you think you\xc2\x92re pretty special huh? Sittin\xc2\x92 up
here in your fancy small hall building. Makin\xc2\x92 stars jump through hoops for ya, huh?
Well y\xc2\x92know what? (Throws the script away) This is one star who\xc2\x92s hoop\xc2\x85
This is a star that the hoop\xc2\x97this hoop\xc2\x97I was Dr. Drake Remoray!'
Hi! Tag. What are you doing here?'

I just wanted to come by and thank you for not laughing in my face\nyesterday. And I noticed there aren\xc2\x92t any plants in your office so I wanted to bring\nyou your first\xc2\x85 (Notices her plant) There is a plant in your office.'
Kinda.'
Right. So I guess I shouldn\xc2\x92t put good at noticing stuff on my resume.\n(Sets the plant down on her desk.)'
Oh-ohh, thank you.'
Anyway, I\xc2\x92m guessing you hired somebody.'
Well\xc2\x85'
Gotcha. Thanks again for meeting with me. (Starts to leave.)'
But I hired you!'
What?'
Yeah! You-you got the job! You\xc2\x92re my new assistant!'
I am?!'
Yeah!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe it!'
Me either. Umm, all right, first thing I need you to do is go downstairs\nand find a women named Hilda and tell her to go home.'
Hey.'
Hey! Good, you\xc2\x92re home!'
Oh it\xc2\x92s always nicer to here than, "Aw crap! You\nagain!"'
Hey baby. (Kisses him.)'
Hey.'
I made you a surprise.'
Oh yeah?'
Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I\xc2\x92ve had such a\ncraving for them.'
Did you not understand the story?'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey! What\xc2\x92s up?'
Ross!'
Oh, nothin\xc2\x92 much. Just trying to figure out what I\xc2\x92m gonna do\nfor dinner.'
Huh.'
(notices the table) Hey\xc2\x97Ooh! What\xc2\x92s-what\xc2\x92s that, dinner\nstuff? You making dinner?'
No! (The oven dings.) Shhh!'
What you got over there? Tacos?'
No! No. They\xc2\x92re umm\xc2\x85 They\xc2\x92re just uh\xc2\x85ground beef\nsmileys. (Holding up one of the shells.)'
Uhh, those are tacos.'
Excuse me Mr. Mexico.'
Eh, either way I\xc2\x92ll pass. (Quietly to Chandler) I still can\xc2\x92t\neat those. (Monica is getting something out of the fridge and starts laughing.)\nWhat\xc2\x92s so funny?!'
(trying not to laugh) I\xc2\x92m not laughing. '
(To Chandler) You told her!'
Nancy Thompson\xc2\x92s getting fired! (Monica slaps him on the\nshoulder.)'
(To Monica) Look, okay-okay I had food poisoning! It\xc2\x92s not like I\nchoose to do it! It\xc2\x92s not like\xc2\x97It\xc2\x92s not like I said, "Umm, what would\nmake this ride more fun?!"'
You\xc2\x92re right. I mean I\xc2\x92m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn\xc2\x92t be\nlaughing. I should be laying down papers for you! (Runs off laughing which gets Chandler\nlaughing.)'
(To Chandler) How could you tell her?!'
I had too okay?! We\xc2\x92re getting married! Married couples\ncan\xc2\x92t keep secrets from one another!'
Oh really? Well I-I guess Monica should know about Atlantic City.'
Du-ude!'
(running up to Ross) What happened in Atlantic City?!'
Well, Chandler and I are in a bar\xc2\x85'
Did you not hear me say, "Du-ude?!"'

And this girl is making eyes at Chandler, okay? So after awhile he-he goes
over to her and uh, after a minute or two, I see them kissing. Now, I know what
you\xc2\x92re thinking, Chandler\xc2\x92s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes
out with girls, and you\xc2\x92re right, Chandler\xc2\x92s not the type of guy who just goes
to bars and makes out with\xc2\x85girls.'
(To Chandler) You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.'
In my defense, it was dark and he was a very pretty guy.'
Oh Mon, I laughed so hard\xc2\x85'
Ho-ho, so hard we had to throw out your underwear again?'
Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.'
Hi!'
Hey.'
Hey\xc2\x97Ooh, how\xc2\x92s Hilda? Is she working out?'
Ohh, my new assistant is working out, yes.'
Was she happy you gave her the job?'
Oh, my-my new assistant has very happy that I hired my new assistant.'

(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh hey! Can you, can you hang on a second? (To
Phoebe and Rachel) It\xc2\x92s the producers over at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. can you excuse me
for a minute? (On phone) Hey, funny you should call. I was just looking over next
week\xc2\x92s script. (Listens) Canceled?! (Listens) Like they\xc2\x92re taking it off the
air? (Listens) Ohh. (Listens) All right, see you Monday. (Listens) We\xc2\x92re not even
shootin\xc2\x92 them anymore?!! (Listens) All right, bye! (Hangs up) They canceled Mac and
C.H.E.E.S.E!'
Sorry.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry Joey.'
Why would they do that?! It was a good show right?!'
You wanna tell secrets?! Okay! Okay! In college, Ross used to wear leg\nwarmers!'
All right! All right! Chandler entered a Vanilla Ice look-a-like contest\nand won!'
Ross came in forth and cried!'
Oh my God! (Laughing)'
Oh, is that funny?! Oh, you-you find that funny?! Well maybe Chandler\nshould know some of your secrets too!'
I-I already told him everything! (Threateningly) You shush!!'
Once Monica was sent to her room without dinner, so she ate the macaroni\noff a jewelry box she\xc2\x92d made.'
Ross used to stay up every Saturday night to watch Golden\nGirls!'
Monica couldn\xc2\x92t tell time \xc2\x91til she was 13!'
It\xc2\x92s hard for some people!'
(To Monica) Of course it is. (Mouths to Ross) Wow\xc2\x97whoa!'
Chandler one time wore my underwear to work!'
Hey!!!'
Ohh, I\xc2\x92m sorry I couldn\xc2\x92t think of anymore for Ross!'
Ohh! Ohh! In college, Chandler got drunk and slept with the lady who\ncleaned our dorm!'
That was you!'
Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.'
How could this happen to me?! Yesterday I had two TV shows! Today,\nI got nothin\xc2\x92!'
Well wait a minute, what happened to Days of Our Lives?'
Uh, well they might be a little mad at me over there.'
What happened?'
Well maybe I got a little upset and maybe I told them where they could go.'
Joey, why would you do that?'
Because they wanted me to audition!'
You! An actor?! That\xc2\x92s madness!'
Rachel Green\xc2\x92s office. (Hangs up.)'
Tag? (He turns and looks at her.) Hi, who was that?'
(shyly) Nobody. I was just practicing.'
Really? (Giggles.)'
Hi!'
Hi! Rachel Green\xc2\x92s office.'
You must be Hilda.'
Yeah, this is Tag. Tag, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, can I see you for a\nsecond? (Goes into office.)'
Phoebe! That\xc2\x92s a great name.'
Oh, you like that? You should hear my phone number.'
(grabbing Phoebe) Okay. We\xc2\x92ll be right back. (They go into her\noffice and she closes the door.)'
So you hired yourself a little treat did ya?'
All right I know, I know how it looks Pheebs, but I\xc2\x92m telling\nyou\xc2\x85'
But-but you know you cannot get involved with your assistant.'

Yes, I know that. I know that. And I know that hiring him was probably\nnot the smartest thing that I\xc2\x92ve ever done. But I\xc2\x92m telling you, from this\nmoment on I swear this is strictly professional. (There\xc2\x92s a knock on the door.) Yes? '
Hey Rachel!'
Hi!'
Cute assistant! What\xc2\x92s his story? Is he\xc2\x85'
Gay? Yeah. (Kathy leaves dejectedly.)'
Hey! Terry.'
Joey Tribbiani! I\xc2\x92m surprised your big head could fit through our\nsmall halls! (Gets up) I gotta go Joey.'
Wait! Terry! Wait\xc2\x97Look\xc2\x97Wait I-I\xc2\x85 Look, I\xc2\x92m really\nsorry about before. I was an idiot thinking I\xc2\x92m too big to audition for you. You\ngotta give me another chance.'
I can\xc2\x92t help you Joey.'
Wait! Terry! Please! Look, I just lost my other job. Okay? You have no\nidea how much I need this. Please, help me out, for old times sake.'
This poor guy\xc2\x92s been in a coma for five years. It\xc2\x92s\nhopeless.'
It\xc2\x92s not hopeless! Dr. Stryker Remoray\xc2\x92s a miracle worker.\nLook, here he comes.'
Good morning. (He walks over to the bed, leans down, and\nwhispers to him.) Drake, it\xc2\x92s your brother Stryker. Can you hear me?'
(jumping up and removing the bandages) I\xc2\x92m back baby! Ha-ha-ha!'
Y\xc2\x92know, in my defense, umm there was no glitter on the macaroni and\nvery little glue.'
And in my defense, the cleaning lady came on to me!'
(To Monica) You have no trouble telling time now right?'
No!'
Quick! What time is it?! (Holds his watch in front of her face.)'
I don\xc2\x92t know! Time to kiss a guy maybe?! (Ross laughs.) What are\nyou laughing at Pampers? (He stops laughing and glares at her.)'
Y\xc2\x92know when I said that because we\xc2\x92re getting married that\nwe should share everything and not have any secrets? '
Yeah?'
Yeah that was stupid. Let\xc2\x92s not do that.'
Ohh, absolutely.'
And! We should keep all the stuff uh, we told each other secret from\neverybody else.'
Yeah, definitely!'
Okay, (gets up) if you\xc2\x92ll excuse me, I-I\xc2\x92m gonna go hang out\nwith some people who don\xc2\x92t know the Space Mountain story.'
Then, I\xc2\x92d steer clear of Phoebe.'
Man! (Monica mouths, "I\xc2\x92m sorry.")'
Yeah, and not that you would, but I wouldn\xc2\x92t hang out\nwith\xc2\x85all the guys in my office.'
(noticing him) Hi! (Puts the pictures away.)'
Do you have a minute?'
Well yeah, sure, what\xc2\x92s up?'
I got asked out twice today when I was at lunch\xc2\x85by guys.'
Oh really?!'
Yeah. Did you tell someone that I was gay?'
Oh, did you not want people to know that?'
But I\xc2\x92m not gay. And I especially wouldn\xc2\x92t want you to think I\nwas gay.'
Why\xc2\x92s that?'
I don\xc2\x92t think I should say.'
Ohh, you can say. Come on, I don\xc2\x92t want you to feel like you\ncan\xc2\x92t tell me things. (Motions for him to sit down.)'
Okay.'
\xc2\x91Kay.'
Well\xc2\x85'
Yeah.'
I\xc2\x92d love to ask out your friend Phoebe.'
(Pause) Yeah, she\xc2\x92s gay.'
